  1. News & Announcements


    Keep up with Pierre

  1. Summer Rec Guide Published

    The City of Pierre’s Summer Recreation Guide is now online and features more than 35 youth programs, as well as recreation opportunities for adults. Read on...

  2. City Preps for Spring Snow Storm; Asks for Citizen Cooperation

    In anticipation of the major spring snow storm expected to hit the Pierre area tomorrow, the City is asking motorists to remove vehicles from Emergency Snow Routes. Read on...

  3. NATIONAL LIBRARY WEEK CELEBRATION STARTS MONDAY

    Monday kicks off the annual National Library Week Celebration at Rawlins Municipal Library in Pierre. As part of the celebration, the Library is giving away prizes to those who sign up for a library card or enroll in a continuing education class. Read on...

  4. Hillsview Driving Range Opens This Weekend

    The driving range will open at 11 a.m. on Saturday. Weather permitting, it will be open daily from 11 a.m. until 7 p.m. until the full course opens for play. Read on...

  5. UNDERWATER EASTER EGG HUNT

    The hunt for Easter eggs will start early in Pierre with the Pierre Parks and Recreation Department’s annual Underwater Easter Egg Hunt on Sunday, April 14. Read on...

  6. GO GREEN AND CLEAN CAMPAIGN LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS

    The Go Green and Clean Campaign is looking for volunteer committee members. The committee leads city-wide cleanup efforts each spring and will have its first meeting for the year on Wednesday, April 3. Read on...

  7. Drinking Water Advisory

    At the recommendation of the EPA and the South Dakota Department of Environment and Natural Resources, the City of Pierre is issuing a drinking water advisory due to the manganese levels naturally present in the City’s public water supply. Read on...

  8. PIERRE FIRE RESCUES DOG

    Shortly after 8 p.m. on March 21, 2019, the Pierre Fire Department Rescue Squad was dispatched to a report of a dog that could not get out of the river due to ice conditions. Read on...

  9. Commission Accepts Pool Proposal

    Tonight, the Pierre City Commission heard and accepted five recommendations from the Outdoor Pool Committee. Read on...

  10. CITY OPENS DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITY FOR DOWNTOWN LOT

    Tonight the Pierre City Commission took steps to redevelop the downtown lot that houses Pierre’s old City Hall. By a unanimous vote, the group decided to issue a Request for Qualified Developers (RFQD) for the site. Read on...

  11. USDOT Selects SkyWest to Serve Pierre

    This evening, the City of Pierre was notified by the U.S. Dept. of Transportation (USDOT) that it has selected SkyWest to provide Essential Air Service (EAS) to the Capital City. Read on...

  12. Pierre to Build Water Treatment Facility

    The City of Pierre has received its marching orders from Pierre voters; a water treatment facility will be built. Read on...
View All
/CivicAlerts.aspx
